metadata.title: CVE-2021-45085 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
XSS can occur in GNOME Web (aka Epiphany) before 40.4 and 41.x before 41.1via an about: page, as demonstrated by ephy-about:overview when a uservisits an XSS payload page often enough to place that page on the MostVisited list.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-45085` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

epiphany-browser - 42.4-1
epiphany-browser-data - 42.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: epiphany-browser package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '42.4-1').
